class News_app.serializers.ArticleApprovalSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for approving Article instances. Used to update approval status and approval date.

Parameters:

  • is_approved – Approval status of the article

  • approval_date – Date the article was approved (read-only)

Returns:

Serialized data for Article approval

class News_app.serializers.ArticleCreateSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for creating Article model instances. Used for simplified article creation with required fields.

Parameters:

  • title – Title of the article

  • content – Content of the article

  • publisher – Publisher of the article

  • category – Category of the article

  • image – Image associated with the article

  • is_independent – Whether the article is independent

Returns:

Serialized data for new Article instance

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

model

alias of Article

create(validated_data)[source]

Create a new Article instance with the provided validated data. This method sets the author from the request context and handles the creation of an article without requiring all fields.

Parameters:

validated_data – Data validated by the serializer

Returns:

The newly created Article instance

class News_app.serializers.ArticleSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for Article model. Handles nested serialization for related fields and write-only IDs for creation.

Parameters:

  • id – ID of the article

  • title – Title of the article

  • content – Content of the article

  • author – Author of the article (UserSerializer, read-only)

  • publisher – Publisher of the article (PublisherSerializer, read-only)

  • category – Category of the article (CategorySerializer, read-only)

  • created_date – Date the article was created (read-only)

  • published_date – Date the article was published

  • updated_date – Date the article was last updated (read-only)

  • is_approved – Approval status of the article

  • approved_by – User who approved the article (UserSerializer, read-only)

  • approval_date – Date the article was approved (read-only)

  • is_published – Publication status of the article

  • image – Image associated with the article

  • is_independent – Whether the article is independent

  • publisher_id – Publisher ID for write operations (write-only)

  • category_id – Category ID for write operations (write-only)

Returns:

Serialized data for Article model

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

fields = ['id', 'title', 'content', 'author', 'publisher', 'category', 'created_date', 'published_date', 'updated_date', 'is_approved', 'approved_by', 'approval_date', 'is_published', 'image', 'is_independent', 'publisher_id', 'category_id']
model

alias of Article

read_only_fields = ['id', 'author', 'created_date', 'updated_date', 'approved_by', 'approval_date']
create(validated_data)[source]

Create a new Article instance with the provided validated data. This method handles the creation of an article, setting the author from the request context, and managing publisher and category IDs.

Parameters:

validated_data – Data validated by the serializer

Returns:

The newly created Article instance

class News_app.serializers.CommentSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for Comment model. Handles serialization of comment data and automatic author assignment.

Parameters:

  • id – ID of the comment

  • article – Article the comment belongs to

  • author – Author of the comment (UserSerializer, read-only)

  • content – Content of the comment

  • created_date – Date the comment was created (read-only)

  • updated_date – Date the comment was last updated (read-only)

Returns:

Serialized data for Comment model

class News_app.serializers.NewsletterSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for Newsletter model. Handles nested serialization for related fields and write-only IDs for creation.

Parameters:

  • id – ID of the newsletter

  • title – Title of the newsletter

  • content – Content of the newsletter

  • author – Author of the newsletter (UserSerializer, read-only)

  • publisher – Publisher of the newsletter (PublisherSerializer, read-only)

  • created_date – Date the newsletter was created (read-only)

  • published_date – Date the newsletter was published

  • updated_date – Date the newsletter was last updated (read-only)

  • is_approved – Approval status of the newsletter

  • approved_by – User who approved the newsletter (UserSerializer, read-only)

  • approval_date – Date the newsletter was approved (read-only)

  • is_published – Publication status of the newsletter

  • is_independent – Whether the newsletter is independent

  • publisher_id – Publisher ID for write operations (write-only)

Returns:

Serialized data for Newsletter model

Bases: object

create(validated_data)[source]

Create a new Newsletter instance with the provided validated data. This method handles the creation of a newsletter, setting the author from the request context, and managing the publisher ID.

validated_data – Data validated by the serializer

Returns:

The newly created Newsletter instance

class News_app.serializers.UserCreateSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for creating User model instances. Handles password hashing and user creation logic.

Parameters:

  • username – Username of the user

  • email – Email address of the user

  • first_name – First name of the user

  • last_name – Last name of the user

  • role – Role of the user (e.g., journalist, publisher)

  • password – Password for the user (write-only)

Returns:

Serialized data for new User instance

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

The newly created User instance

class News_app.serializers.UserSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for User model. Converts User model instances to JSON format and vice versa. Includes fields like username, email, first_name, last_name, and role.

Parameters:

  • username – Username of the user

  • email – Email address of the user

  • first_name – First name of the user

  • last_name – Last name of the user

  • role – Role of the user (e.g., journalist, publisher)

Returns:

Serialized data for User model
